comment:
/**
   *
   * Create a new JSON file for storing or initialize an exisiting file to be used.
   *
   * @param {string} database The name of the JSON file to be created or used.
   * @returns {boolean} Returns true.
   * @example
   * const jsoning = require('jsoning');
   * var database = new jsoning("database.json");
   *
   */
description: Create a new JSON file for storing or initialize an exisiting file to be used.

params.description: The name of the JSON file to be created or used.
params.name: database

examples: const jsoning = require('jsoning');var database = new jsoning("database.json");
name: Jsoning

description: Returns all the elements and their values of the JSON file.

returns.description: All the key-value pairs of the database.

examples: database.set("foo", "bar");database.set("hi", "hello");let all = database.all();console.log(all); // { "foo": "bar", "hi": "hello" }
name: all
clear

comment:
/**
   *
   * Deletes an element from the database based on its key.
   *
   * @param {string} key The key of the element to be deleted.
   * @returns {Boolean} Returns true if the value exists, else returns false.
   * @example
   * database.set("ping", "pong");
   * database.set("foo", "bar");
   *
   * database.delete("foo"); // returns true
   *
   */
description: Deletes an element from the database based on its key.

params.description: The key of the element to be deleted.
params.name: key

returns.description: Returns true if the value exists, else returns false.

name: delete

comment:
/**
   *
   * Gets the value of an element based on it's key.
   *
   * @param {string} key The key of the element to be fetched.
   * @returns {*} Returns value, if element exists, else returns false.
   * @example
   * database.set("food", "pizza");
   *
   * let food = database.get("food");
   * console.log(food) // returns pizza
   *
   */
description: Gets the value of an element based on it's key.

params.description: The key of the element to be fetched.
params.name: key

returns.description: Returns value, if element exists, else returns false.

examples: database.set("food", "pizza");let food = database.get("food");console.log(food) // returns pizza
name: get

comment:
/**
   *
   * Check if a particular element exists by key.
   *
   * @param {string} key The key of the element to see if the element exists.
   *
   * @returns {Boolean} True if the element exists, false if the element doesn't exist.
   *
   * @example
   * database.set("some value", "hi");
   *
   * let has = database.has("some value");
   * console.log(has); // returns true
   *
   * let has2 = database.has("value");
   * console.log(has2); // returns false
   */
description: Check if a particular element exists by key.

params.description: The key of the element to see if the element exists.
params.name: key

returns.description: True if the element exists, false if the element doesn't exist.

examples: database.set("some value", "hi");let has = database.has("some value");console.log(has); // returns truelet has2 = database.has("value");console.log(has2); // returns false
name: has

comment:
/**
   *
   * Performs mathematical operations on values of elements.
   *
   * @param {string} key The key of the element on which the mathematical operation is to be performed.
   * @param {string} operation The operation to perform, one of add, subtract, multiply and divide.
   * @param {number} operand The number for performing the mathematical operation (the operand).
   *
   * @returns {Boolean} True if the operation succeeded, else false.
   *
   * @example
   * database.set("value1", 1);
   * database.set("value2", 10);
   *
   * database.math("value1", "add", 1);
   * database.math("value2", "multiply", 5);
   *
   * console.log(database.get("value1")); // returns 1+1 = 2
   * console.log(database.get("value2")); // returns 10*5 = 50
   *
   */
description: Performs mathematical operations on values of elements.

params.description: The key of the element on which the mathematical operation is to be performed.
params.name: key

params.description: The operation to perform, one of add, subtract, multiply and divide.
params.name: operation

params.description: The number for performing the mathematical operation (the operand).
params.name: operand

returns.description: True if the operation succeeded, else false.

examples: database.set("value1", 1);database.set("value2", 10);database.math("value1", "add", 1);database.math("value2", "multiply", 5);console.log(database.get("value1")); // returns 1+1 = 2console.log(database.get("value2")); // returns 10*5 = 50
name: math

comment:
/**
   *
   * This function will push the given value into the provided element (if it's an array) in the database based on the key. If no such element exists, it will initialize a new element with an empty array.
   *
   * @param {string} key
   * @param {(string|number|boolean|null|undefined|Object)} value
   *
   * @returns {Boolean} True if the the value was pushed to an array successfully, else false.
   *
   * @example
   * database.push("leaderboard", "khaleel");
   * database.push("leaderboard", "RiversideRocks");
   *
   */
description: This function will push the given value into the provided element (if it's an array) in the database based on the key. If no such element exists, it will initialize a new element with an empty array.

returns.description: True if the the value was pushed to an array successfully, else false.

name: push

description: Adds an element to the database with the specified value. If element with the given key exists, element value is updated.

params.description: Key of the element to be set.
params.name: key

params.description: Value of the element to be set.
params.name: value

returns.description: If element is set/updated successfully, returns true; else false.

examples: database.set("foo", "bar");database.set("hi", 3);database.set("en", "db"); // { "en": "db" }database.set("en", "en"); // { "en": "en" }let set = database.set("khaleel", "gibran");console.log(set); // returns true
name: set
